Grouped_Utterances: Hi, Ellie! I actually did it! I called one of the therapists, and I have an appointment next week!

It was nerve-wracking, but I felt really relieved afterward. I think I chose someone who understands PTSD. I’ve had some ups and downs, but I’ve been trying to stay positive. The grounding exercises help, but I still have tough days. I guess I’m still worried about how the first session will go.
They have experience with trauma and anxiety, and they seemed really compassionate on the phone.
I think just making the call to the therapist. It felt like a big step. I feel proud of myself. I’m starting to believe that I can really work through this.
I’ve been using the breathing techniques we talked about, and I also try to distract myself with music or video games.

You might want to talk about your experiences with PTSD and how it affects your daily life, as well as your goals for therapy.  That’s an incredible mindset to have! Keep holding onto that belief. Let’s check in next week to see how your appointment goes.
